title: Copying answers
text: methods require sysrev technical support ESR articles labels can copied new project cloning, previous answers can assigned rsr::review rsr::copy_answers. ESR project cloned “Clone ESR” tests run confirm clone worked: article_data_id (adid) shared article id. Since CPY ESR clone, adids: global_label_id (glid) shared label id. Since CPY ESR clone, glids: rsr::copy_answers copies answers projects shared adids/glids: copying, quick plot shows identical answers source clone:
code: # clone ESR CPY = clone_sysrev(ESR.pid,"Clone ESR")  # get cloned lbls & articles tibbles CPY.lbl = get_labels(CPY$pid)   # 9  x 15 CPY.art = get_articles(CPY$pid) # 31 x 11 # Test if all ESR articles in the clone setequal(ESR.art$article_data_id,          CPY.art$article_data_id) #> [1] TRUE # Test if all ESR labels in clone setequal(ESR.lbl$global_label_id,          CPY.lbl$global_label_id) #> [1] TRUE copy_answers(source.pid = ESR.pid,              target.pid = CPY$pid)

title: Copying answers
text: Final code video :
code: ESR.pid = 111200 CLN.pid = 115689  # look at source answers get_answers(ESR.pid)  # look at source labels ESR.lbl = get_labels(ESR.pid) |>    arrange(project_ordering) |>    select(short_label,global_label_id)  # look at clone labels CLN.lbl = get_labels(CLN.pid) |>    arrange(project_ordering) |>    select(short_label,global_label_id)  # look at source adids ESR.art = get_articles(ESR.pid) |>    select(aid,article_data_id)  # look at clone adids CLN.art = get_articles(CLN.pid) |>    select(aid,article_data_id)  # copy answers source -> clone copy_answers(ESR.pid,CLN.pid)  # get project w/ one imported label IMP.pid = 115697 IMP.lbl = rsr::get_labels(IMP.pid) |>    arrange(project_ordering) |>    select(short_label,global_label_id)  # copy answers from source to import copy_answers(source.pid = ESR.pid,               target.pid = IMP.pid)

title: Track organization progress
text: rsr::get_sysrevs gets sysrevs given organization. first project can found (sysrev.com/p/77703). project names, creation dates, roles available.
code: sysrevs = rsr::get_sysrevs("Ontox") #> # A tibble: 21 × 3 #>   project_id name                                               roles         #>        <int> <chr>                                              <list>        #> 1      77703 PAUSED/COMPLETE: Cholestasis Title/Abstract Screen <df [42 × 3]> #> 2      90507 PAUSED:  Master Screening Labels                   <df [41 × 3]> #> # … with 19 more rows

title: Track organization progress
text: Project administrators can discovered unnesting roles column.
code: sysrevs |> unnest(roles) |> filter(role=="admin") #> # A tibble: 92 × 4 #>   project_id name                                               username   role  #>        <int> <chr>                                              <chr>      <chr> #> 1      77703 PAUSED/COMPLETE: Cholestasis Title/Abstract Screen tom-sysrev admin #> 2      77703 PAUSED/COMPLETE: Cholestasis Title/Abstract Screen bot        admin #> # … with 90 more rows

title: Track organization progress
text: active different projects? get_answers gets projects answers. Run every project get organization answers. p.answers function guarantees section run, even get_answers breaks specific project.
code: p.answers  = possibly(rsr::get_answers,otherwise = tibble()) sr.answers = sysrevs |>    select(project_id,name) |>    mutate(answers = map(project_id,p.answers)) |>    unnest(answers) #> # A tibble: 69,859 × 12 #>   project_id name       aid title lid   user_id confirm_time resolve short_label #>        <int> <chr>    <int> <chr> <chr>   <int> <chr>        <lgl>   <chr>       #> 1      77703 PAUSED… 1.28e7 Mech… 8174…    6058 2021-12-19 … FALSE   Include     #> 2      77703 PAUSED… 1.28e7 Mech… d6e9…    6058 2021-12-19 … FALSE   Sufficient… #> # … with 69,857 more rows, and 3 more variables: value_type <chr>, #> #   answer <chr>, resolve_time <chr>

title: rsr
text: Create analyze Sysrev data. WARNING: rsr development. Everything may change quickly Install Authenticate Get sysrev token sysrev.com user page. Pubmed example Setup simple review pubmed title/abstracts.
code: devtools::install_github('sysrev/rsr') library(rsr)  # Create/get a sysrev project sr = create_sysrev("rsr",get_if_exists=T)  # Import articles from pubmed with pmids create_source_pmids(sr,pmids=c(1000,10001))  # pull article data into R get_articles(sr) #      aid title                                       #    <int> <chr>                                       # 13747809 The amino acid sequence… # 13747810 Study of the biological… # # project_id <int>, title <chr> …  browse_sysrev(sr) # Open sysrev in browser
